response.description: The '/statuses' API endpoint provides a list of possible statuses that describe the type of visa requirement or entry permission for a traveler depending on their citizenship and the country they wish to enter. Each status represents a different level of restriction or accessibility for travelers. Below you will find the statuses explained:

statuses.explanation: Travelers can enter the country without obtaining a visa in advance.
Travelers can obtain a visa upon arrival at the destination country.
Travelers must apply for and obtain an electronic visa (e-Visa) prior to arrival.
Travelers must apply for and obtain a visa prior to arrival by visiting an embassy or consulate of the destination country.
Travelers from certain countries or regions may be banned from entering due to COVID-19 restrictions.
Travelers are not admitted into the country under any standard circumstances, which may be due to diplomatic issues or sanctions.
Travelers must obtain a special type of entry permit, like the 'Hayya Card' used during the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar, which serves both as a fan ID and visa equivalent.
